setting.name: expire_date_ticket_view
setting.description: When a user is expired because of the date, should the user be able to view their tickets?

setting.name: expire_date_ticket_modify
setting.description: When a user is expired because of the date, should the user be able to modify their tickets, including making follow up replies?

setting.name: expire_date_other
setting.description: When a user is expired because of the date, should the user be able to perform other user based actions, including viewing the knowledgebase & troubleshooter, creating knowledgebase articles, subscribing to knowledgebase articles & modifying their profile.

setting.name: expire_tickets_ticket_view
setting.display_name: Ticket Expiration : Allow Ticket View for Closed Tickets
setting.description: When a user is expired because of the amount of tickets submitted, should the user be able to access resolved tickets? Unresolved tickets will be accessible to the user.

setting.name: expire_tickets_other
setting.description: When a user is expired because of the amount of tickets submitted, should the user be able to perform other user based actions, including viewing the knowledgebase & troubleshooter, creating knowledgebase articles, subscribing to knowledgebase articles & modifying their profile.

settingscat.name: attachments
settingscat.description: Settings controlling the use of attachments

setting.name: attachments_user
setting.description: Do you wish to allow attachments to be uploaded by users of {$DP_NAME}.

setting.name: attachments_user_size
setting.description: This value specifies the maximum size (in megabytes) an attachment can be when uploaded by a user.

setting.name: user_extensions_allowed
setting.description: This specifies a list of extensions that {$DP_NAME} will permit for attachments uploaded by users. Specify this in a comma-separated list. If left blank, all attachments will be accepted, if any attachments are entered then nothing apart from those attachments will be accepted.

setting.name: user_extensions_disabled
setting.description: This specifies a list of extensions that {$DP_NAME} will refuse for attachments uploaded by users. Specify this in a comma-separated list. Leave blank to disable.

setting.name: attachment_max_user_email
setting.display_name: Max Attachment Size for Tech Notifications
setting.description: This setting sets the max size for attachments that will be emailed to users as part of notifications. If the user is not sent the attachment, they will be supplied a link to directly download the attachment from the helpdesk.

setting.name: attachments_tech_size
setting.description: This value specifies the maximum size (in megabytes) an attachment can be when uploaded by a technician.

setting.name: tech_extensions_allowed
setting.description: This specifies a list of extensions that {$DP_NAME} will permit for attachments uploaded by technicians. Specify this in a comma-separated list. If left blank, all attachments will be accepted, if any attachments are entered then nothing apart from those attachments will be accepted.

setting.name: tech_extensions_disabled
setting.description: This specifies a list of extensions that {$DP_NAME} will refuse for attachments uploaded by technicians. Specify this in a comma-separated list. Leave blank to disable.

setting.name: attachment_max_tech_email
setting.display_name: Max Attachment Size for Tech Notifications
setting.description: This setting sets the max size for attachments that will be emailed to techs as part of notifications. If you have a number of techs who receive notifications and you set this high; you can add quite a lot of load to your system; if for example the system has to send 50MB of emails every time a user uploads a 1MB attachment. If the tech is not sent the attachment, they will be supplied a link to directly download the attachment from the helpdesk.

setting.name: cleanup_cronlog
setting.description: Cron log entries older than this setting (in days) will be deleted. Set to 0 to prevent deletion.

setting.name: cleanup_sources
setting.description: Gateway source emails older than this setting (in days) will be deleted. Set to 0 to prevent deletion. You may wish to disable source email deletion if you want to have a reference to the source email in the future, however keeping source emails will increase the size of your database rapidly.

setting.name: cleanup_gateway_errors
setting.description: Email gateway rejections older than this setting (in days) will be deleted along with their email source. Set to 0 to prevent deletion.

setting.name: cleanup_loginlog
setting.description: Login log entries older than this setting (in days) will be deleted. Set to 0 to prevent deletion.

setting.name: cleanup_tracking
setting.description: Tracking (user cookie tracking, logs pages viewed etc) with no activity in over this many days will be deleted. Set to 0 to prevent deletion.

setting.name: cleanup_tracking_log
setting.description: Individual tracking "tracks" (specific pages etc) that were created this many days ago be deleted. Set to 0 to prevent deletion.

setting.name: disable_natural_ticket_search
setting.description: On very large databases, natural search (that is, searching within messages for phrases or words) can be very resource intensive. You may want to disable this type of search, forcing your techs to find tickets on other criteria like dates or categories etc. Before disabling natural search, you might want to try the below setting first.

setting.name: natural_search_maxage_days
setting.display_name: Max age (in days) of tickets returned with a natural search
setting.description: When using natural search, define the maximum age of a ticket to be returned. The shorter the age, the faster the search will take and the less resources will be used. If your database is large and you are experiencing slow natural searches, try setting this value (start at 90 days and play around until you find an appropriate value).

settingscat.name: payment
settingscat.description: These settings control the time tracking and billing features of {$DP_NAME}.

setting.name: payments
setting.description: If enabled, {$DP_NAME} will display payment tracking functions in the Technician and Administration interfaces. Disabling this feature after enabling it will not delete existing billing information.

setting.name: payments_auto
setting.description: This will automatically start the timer when a tech views a ticket; it will also preselect the option to charge the user for the time spent when the tech replies.

setting.name: cron_auto_cron
setting.description: If you enable this setting {$DP_NAME} will create an image in the footer of the tech and user interface which is used to run the {$DP_NAME} scheduled tasks. This is only recommended if you are unable to setup a cron task (on linux) or a scheduled task (on windows).

setting.name: use_gzip
setting.description: Do you wish to enable gzip. This will compress and thus reduce the size of your html pages.

setting.name: graphing
setting.description: Do you wish {$DP_NAME} to generate graphs? This feature has a number of server requirements. If your server does not meet these, you can disable graphing to prevent the generation of error messages.

setting.name: safe_mode_upload
setting.description: If your server runs PHP with SAFE MODE Restrictions, set this to yes. You should only set this to yes if you are having problems with attachment uploads.

setting.name: safe_mode_dir
setting.description: If your server is running in PHP Safe Mode, you'll need to specify a directory that is CHMOD to 777 that will act as a temporary directory for uploads. All files are removed from this directory after database insertion.Note: Do NOT include the trailing slash ('/') after the directory name

setting.name: post_ref_whitelist
setting.description: For security reasons, {$DP_NAME} denies some requests if the page referer is not the same domain as the helpdesk. If you need to allow other domains (for example, your main site has a search box for your helpdesk) then enter them here. Enter only the domain, separate multiple domains by a comma. Do not insert paths (/index.php for example) or 'http://'. Valid examples are: example.com, subdomain.example.com

setting.name: user_session_length
setting.description: This setting determines the length, in seconds, a user session can be idle before it is expired.

setting.name: tech_session_length
setting.description: This setting determines the length, in seconds, a tech session can be idle before it is expired.

setting.name: admin_session_length
setting.description: This setting determines the length, in seconds, an admin session can be idle before it is expired.

setting.name: cookie_path
setting.description: You only need to set this if you have two installations of {$DP_NAME} running on the same domain. You can then set a path to restrict the cookie to, for example helpdesk1 and helpdesk2. Be very careful when setting this value, if you set it wrong you will lock yourself out of both the admin and tech interface and will need to edit this value directly in mySQL to regain access.

settingscat.name: email
settingscat.description: These settings control the email functions of DeskPRO

setting.name: email_from
setting.description: This is the email address that notifications for which no reply is expected will be sent by {$DP_NAME}. The type of mailings sent will be notification email including registration emails, notifications such as knowledgebase articles or error emails from the email gateway. You will probably want to auto delete any emails that get sent to this address. It is essential that this is a valid email address or some servers will not send the email. It is also important that you do *not* collect this email using the email gateway.

setting.name: email_from_name
setting.description: The name that notifications will be sent from.

setting.name: email_offemail
setting.description: This is your emergency off helpdesk email. This will be shown to users in the case of a serious problem which prevents {$DP_NAME} from working. This email should be monitored regularly.

setting.name: email_linereturns
setting.description: Your mail server might require you to change the line returns that emails are sent with. You can set them here

setting.name: email_footer_tech
setting.description: Add the technician footer email template to all outgoing emails to technicians.

setting.name: email_ticketfields_tech
setting.display_name: Include custom ticket fields in tech notifications
setting.description: When enabled, relevant custom ticket field values will be added to the email notifications sent to techs for new tickets, new replies and assignments.

setting.name: email_footer_user
setting.description: Add the user footer email template to all outgoing emails to users.

setting.name: email_failed_retry
setting.display_name: Number of times to retry sending failed emails
setting.description: If an email fails to send, {$DP_NAME} will log the email and try and send it again later. How many tries should {$DP_NAME} attempt to make before the email is deleted? (0 to disable)

settingscat.name: smtp
settingscat.description: Use the internal SMTP mail sending system

setting.name: use_smtp
setting.description: Send emails using the included SMTP server. If disabled mail will be sent through the standard php mail() function. If you have problems using the php mail() function, you should check the settings are correct inside your php.ini file.

setting.name: smtp_host
setting.description: If SMTP mailing is enabled, this value specifies the server to use for SMTP mailing. The default (for SMTP server on your web server) is localhost.

setting.name: smtp_port
setting.description: If SMTP mailing is enabled, this value specifies the port number to connect to on the SMTP server for mailing. The default value, 25, is almost universally standard; you should change this only if you know your SMTP server is running on a non-standard port.

setting.name: smtp_ssl
setting.description: If your SMTP server requires secure communications (SSL), enable this option. If this is enabled, your port (the above setting) will probably be 465 unless it is non-standard.

setting.name: smtp_helo
setting.description: If SMTP mailing is enabled, this value specifies what identification string {$DP_NAME} will send to the SMTP server as part of its introductory message. Your domain name is often a good choice.

setting.name: smtp_auth
setting.description: If SMTP mailing is enabled, this value specifies whether SMTP auth should be used.

setting.name: smtp_user
setting.description: If SMTP authentication is enabled, this value specifies the username that will be used during SMTP authentication.

setting.name: smtp_pass
setting.description: If SMTP authentication is enabled, this value specifies the password that will be used during SMTP authentication.

setting.name: max_message_size
setting.description: This value specifies the largest size (in MB) message that will be accepted by {$DP_NAME} when it retrieves mail. Messages larger than this size will be deleted and the user notified. If you have low amounts of RAM available per PHP process it is important this setting is not set too high (1 MB is recommended)

setting.name: gateway_reply_cut
setting.description: When this is enabled the helpdesk will attempt to ignore any text entered below the reply line (wordref gateway_reply_cut). This is useful to prevent lots of quoting of messages.

setting.name: gateway_no_del_msg
setting.description: Leave POP3 email messages on the server instead of deleting them?

setting.name: gateway_allow_empty_body
setting.description: Allow new tickets to be created with empty bodies? For example, if you use some system where the email address and subject are the only important thing. Note this only affects empty bodies and new tickets; an empty bodied reply on a ticket will still be discarded.

setting.name: gateway_num_newticket_autosearch
setting.description: When the KB suggestion features are enabeld (see mail rules), what is the maximum number of articles to return?

setting.name: max_new
setting.description: This setting is the maximum amount of tickets that a user can create in an hour. It should be larger than the Max New Tickets Warning setting. Any new ticket emails sent breaching this limit will not be processed.

setting.name: max_reply_warning
setting.description: It is important to have a limit on the number of emails a user can send in an hour to prevent a possible autoresponder loop. Once this limit is reached the user will be marked as an autoresponder and automatic ticket notifications will not be sent to them. A tech response to the ticket will reset the number. Set to 0 to disable. Identical emails will always be ignored.

setting.name: max_subject_warning
setting.description: A warning will be sent and the user marked as an autoresponder if this number of emails is received with identical subjects.

setting.name: max_new_warning
setting.description: It is important to have a limit on the number of emails a user can send in an hour to prevent a possible autoresponder loop. This setting is the warning amount, when the amount is reached a separate email is sent to the user asking them to not send new emails so quickly and to explain that they will not receive anymore automatic notifications from {$DP_NAME}.

setting.name: site_url
setting.description: This setting specifies the URL to your company's main web site. This is not {$DP_NAME} URL, but just a link of convenience to make available to your users. They can click this link to exit your support pages and return here. This can be any link you desire; it does not affect {$DP_NAME}'s behaviour.

setting.name: helpdesk_url
setting.description: This setting specifies the base URL your users will use to access your {$DP_NAME} installation. This is used to generate links within {$DP_NAME}'s interface. In most cases, the installation and upgrade scripts' auto detected value are correct. The url must end with a trailing slash.

setting.name: site_name
setting.description: This setting specifies the human-readable name {$DP_NAME} to your users.

setting.name: helpdesk_enabled
setting.description: Set yes to turn the helpdesk on. If the helpdesk is not turned on, users will not be allowed to enter the help desk; instead they will be shown the Help desk disabled message. The administrator and tech interfaces will still be active. If you have POP3 mail collection setup, mail will not be processed. Mail sent by PIPE will be logged to the database awaiting the turning on of the helpdesk.

setting.name: enable_wysiwyg
setting.description: Set yes to enable WYSIWYG editors in the tech interface. These editors show up when managaing articles, troubleshooters, private messages etc.

setting.name: force_ssl
setting.description: Enable this option for force SSL encryption on all communications. If you enable this, {$DP_NAME} will redirect all non-HTTPS requests to HTTPS. If you enable this option, the above helpdesk URL should also start with 'https://'. Warning: If your server isn't equip to properly serve https, then your users will be unable to use the helpdesk because the https URL will not load. After enabling this option you should check to make sure your helpdesk front-page loads properly.

setting.name: autocorrect_domain
setting.description: When this setting is enabled, {$DP_NAME} will try and force users on to a single domain name. For example, you might have a subdomain "helpdesk.example.org" that maps to "example.org/helpdesk/". If "helpdesk.example.org" is the domain you entered above as your helpdesk URL, then {$DP_NAME} will redirect users who come from "example.org/helpdesk/". Warning: After enabling this option you should check that your helpdesk front-page loads properly in case the above domain is incorrect and users are automatically redirected to a non-functioning URL.

settingscat.name: users
settingscat.description: These settings control the user functions of {$DP_NAME}

setting.name: min_username_length
setting.description: The minimum length of username a user can choose when registering.

setting.name: user_captcha_register
setting.description: Enable image verification to ensure users are human and not automated bots. Please be sure your server supports the required technologies before enabling this option. You can check by running the CAPTCHA test.

settingscat.name: techs
settingscat.description: These settings control the tech functions of {$DP_NAME}

setting.name: tech_header_title
setting.description: This is the title displayed in the top left of the tech interface.

setting.name: tech_immediate_redirects
setting.description: When enabled, the redirection screens will be disabled. These are the screens that confirm a particular action was successfull and end with "You will be redirected automatically..."

setting.name: tech_display_name
setting.display_name: Show Tech Display Name in Tech Interface
setting.description: When enabled, the tech interface will always show the techs display name instead of the username. If the tech has not entered a display name for themselves, then the username will be displayed.

setting.name: email_on_admin_login
setting.display_name: Send email notifications for admin logins
setting.description: When enabled, an email will be sent to the email address of the admin that is logging in.

setting.name: email_on_admin_login_all
setting.display_name: Send email notifications for every admin login
setting.description: Enter an email address (or multiple email addresses, separated by a comma) to send login notifcations to for ALL admin logins.

setting.name: email_on_admin_login_failed
setting.display_name: Send email notifications for failed admin logins
setting.description: When enabled, an email will be sent to the email address of the admin that failed logging in.

setting.name: email_on_admin_login_failed_all
setting.display_name: Send email notifications for every failed admin login
setting.description: Enter an email address (or multiple email addresses, separated by a comma) to send login notifcations to for ALL failed admin logins.

setting.name: tech_invalid_pass_lockout
setting.description: How many logins can be attempted before the system locks the account for 1 hour? (0 disables)

settingscat.name: date
settingscat.description: These settings control the display of Dates within {$DP_NAME}

setting.description: This is the default timezone for your users. If you are based in New York you should set New York as your default timezone. All technicians and users who do not set their own timezone will have dates displayed in this timezone.

setting.name: dst
setting.description: If Daylight Savings Time is currently in effect in your timezone, enable this setting.

setting.name: date_full
setting.value: D, jS M Y g:i a
setting.description: {$DP_NAME} uses this value to format "full" date displays (used when both the date and time are to be displayed). This is based on the specification shown here.

setting.name: date_day
setting.description: {$DP_NAME} uses this value to format "short" date displays (used when just the date is to be displayed). This is based on the specification shown here.

setting.name: date_time
setting.description: {$DP_NAME} uses this value to format "time" date displays (used when just the time is to be displayed). This is based on the specification shown here.

setting.name: language_on
setting.description: If set to "yes", your users will be able to change the deskpro interface to the languages you have enabled in the language section.

setting.name: language_translate_on
setting.description: If set to "yes", the language interface will allow you to create and submit to {$DP_NAME} custom new languages for translation and complete updates of {$DP_NAME} provided languages.

setting.name: staff_interface_charset
setting.description: This is the charset that will be used when you use the admin or tech interface. For example, if the primary language of the helpdesk is not English you may need to change this charset.

setting.name: gateway_lang_detect
setting.description: When this is enabled, the helpdesk will atempt to automatically detect the language of an incoming email message based on the installed languages. For the most effective detection, you must have the iconv PHP module available. Please note that if you install similar languages (for example Norwegian and Danish) then you may experience false-positives.

setting.name: template_allow_include
setting.description: If set to "yes", you will be able to include files directly into your templates with the <%include%>/path/file.php<%endinclude%> tag.

setting.name: enable_link_parser
setting.description: If set to "yes," some plain-text content in the helpdesk including things like ticket messages or KB comments will be put through a parser to detect URL's and automatically make them clickable links. The parser is not perfect and may create links out of text that aren't meant to be links.

settingscat.name: kb_general
settingscat.description: These settings control some aspects of the knowledgebase

setting.name: faq_days
setting.description: Set in days, this setting controls how long an article is new or updated.

setting.name: user_captcha_kb_comment
setting.description: Enable a CAPTCHA for unregistered users wanting to submit comments to articles?

setting.name: addthis_username
setting.description: Display an AddThis widget in the sidebar of your articles by inputting your username for this setting.

setting.name: faq_front_show_popular
setting.display_name: Front Page Display : Number of Popular Articles
setting.description: This specifies the number of popular Knowledgebase articles to display on the user Knowledgebase home page. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

setting.name: faq_front_show_featured
setting.display_name: Front Page Display : Number of Top Featured Articles
setting.description: This specifies the number of top rated knowledgebase articles to display on the user Knowledgebase home page. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

setting.name: faq_front_show_new
setting.display_name: Front Page Display : Number of New & Updated Articles
setting.description: This specifies the number of new/updated knowledgebase articles to display on the user Knowledgebase home page. Set to 0 to disable this feature.

setting.name: faq_front_noduplicates
setting.description: For the various listings of articles on the Front page, prevent duplicates from appearing.

setting.name: faq_category_show_cats
setting.description: When categories are display on the front page and category page; would you like to show subcategories. Set a number for the maximum number of subcategories you would like to show or 0 to disable.

setting.name: faq_category_show_articles
setting.description: When categories are display on the front page and category page; would you like to show article titles from that category. Set a number for the maximum number of articles you would like to show or 0 to disable.

setting.name: faq_category_show_description
setting.description: When categories are displayed on the front page and category page would you like to show the category descriptions?

setting.name: faq_category_show_template
setting.description: Would you like the default category template to be the template that lists articles in a tabular list, or the template that lists articles in a Question - Answer format?

setting.name: faq_columns
setting.description: The number of columns used to display knowledgebase categories.

settingscat.name: tickets
settingscat.description: These settings control ticket properties and display

setting.name: user_feedback
setting.description: Allow users to rate the quality of responses to a ticket

setting.name: disable_newticket_autosearch
setting.description: Disable the auto-searching of your knowledgebase when the user submits a ticket from the web interface.

setting.name: num_newticket_autosearch
setting.description: The maximum number of results to return with the knowledgebase auto-search when a user submits a new ticket.

setting.name: lock_time
setting.description: How long should a ticket be locked for (in minutes) when a technician locks a ticket preventing other techs from replying

setting.name: ticket_tech_owner_view
setting.description: Enable to show to users the name of the technician a ticket is assigned to.

setting.name: message_tech_owner_view
setting.description: Do you wish to allow users to view the technician that wrote a message. Enabling this "personalises" a response, disabling it depersonalises your responses.

setting.name: max_size
setting.description: This value specifies the largest message (number of characters) {$DP_NAME} will accept for a ticket message or reply. Messages larger than this value will be rejected.

setting.name: ticket_token
setting.description: You enable an added security measure to prevent automated bots submitting tickets by requiring a special token to be generated when the user wishes to create a new ticket. However, this will prevent you from being able to create your own forms and posting them to {$DP_NAME}.

setting.name: ticket_logged_out_create
setting.display_name: Enable ticket creation from a logged out user
setting.description: If a logged out user that exists in the {$DP_NAME} database tries to create a ticket with an email that matches, by default {$DP_NAME} will create a temporary ticket and ask the user to login before finalising the ticket. This is to prevent a 3rd party creating a ticket for someone else. If you wish to allow tickets to be created without logging in, set this setting to Yes. The user will then be able to create the ticket but will not be able to view the ticket in the web interface until they log in.

setting.name: ticket_autouser
setting.display_name: Enable automatic user creation via posted forms
setting.description: When enabled, {$DP_NAME} will allow you to post forms to newticket.php which can be automatically turned into a new ticket and automatically have a user account created. For more information on how to do this properly, please refer to this Knowledgebase article.

setting.name: category_user_viewable
setting.description: If enabled users will be able to see ticket categories. If disabled, all references to ticket categories will be removed. If disabled, this setting will override all other category settings.

setting.name: category_user_start
setting.description: Allows users to select the category for a new ticket created through the web interface. If disabled, this will override the require category setting.

setting.name: category_require_selection
setting.description: Require your users to select a category when creating a new ticket through the web interface. If you allow the user to modify the ticket category, enabling this setting will prevent them from not choosing a category.

setting.name: category_user_editable
setting.description: Allows users to modify the category by editing the ticket through the web interface.

setting.name: priority_user_viewable
setting.description: If enabled users will be able to see ticket priorities. If disabled, all references to ticket priorities will be removed. If disabled, this setting will override all other priority settings.

setting.name: priority_user_start
setting.description: Allows users to select the priority for a new ticket created through the web interface. If disabled, this will override the require priority setting.

setting.name: priority_require_selection
setting.description: Require your users to select a priority when creating a new ticket through the web interface. If you allow the user to modify the ticket category, enabling this setting will prevent them from not choosing a category.

setting.name: priority_user_editable
setting.description: Allows users to modify the category by editing the ticket through the web interface.

settingscat.name: autoclose
settingscat.description: The settings control the automatic closure of tickets

setting.name: autoclose_tickets
setting.description: By setting this option, tickets that have been awaiting a user reply after the specified number of days will be automatically closed. Enter a number in days to enable this setting. To disable auto ticket closure enter 0.

setting.name: autoclose_email
setting.description: Select yes to send an email to the user when their ticket is closed.

settingscat.name: ticketcheckbox
settingscat.description: These settings control the default checkboxes for ticket creation and reply

setting.name: ticket_default_new_email
setting.description: Set the default for the 'e-mail user upon ticket creation' checkbox

setting.name: ticket_default_reply_ownership
setting.description: Set the default for the 'claim ownership' checkbox on ticket reply

setting.name: ticket_default_reply_email
setting.description: Set the default for the 'e-email this reply to the user' checkbox

setting.name: ticket_default_reply_status
setting.description: Set the default for the change status checkbox that will set the ticket status to awaiting user

settingscat.name: gateway_hidden
settingscat.description: These settings control the tech to user email gateway

setting.name: gateway_webmail_on
setting.description: Enable webmail

setting.name: gateway_pop_lastrun
setting.description: Last Run Time

setting.name: gateway_tickets_lastrun
setting.display_name: Last Run Time of the gateway tickets script
setting.description: Last Run Time

setting.name: gateway_tickets_active
setting.display_name: If the gateway tickets script is active

setting.name: gateway_decode_lastrun
setting.display_name: Last Run Time of the gateway decode script
setting.description: Last Run Time

setting.name: gateway_decode_active
setting.display_name: If the gateway decode script is active

setting.name: cron_auto_pop
setting.description: If you enable this setting {$DP_NAME} will create an image in the footer of the tech and user interface which is used to run POP3 mail processing. This is only recommended if you are unable to setup a cron task (on linux) or a scheduled task (on windows).

setting.name: register_welcome
setting.description: If enabled a welcome email will be sent to users who register, either by completing the registration form or if registration happened when creating a ticket. Disabling this feature will have no effect if you require either user or tech validation of accounts. Only applies to web interface.

setting.name: register_gateway_welcome
setting.description: If enabled a welcome email will be sent to users when they first send an email letting them know an account has been created for them. This is useful to let the user know their username and password and introduce the idea that they are using a helpdesk. Note that if you have the new ticket autoresponders turned on, the user will receive two emails.

setting.name: deskpro_version
setting.description: The current {$DP_NAME} version (not user adjustable)

setting.name: deskpro_version_internal
setting.description: The internal deskpro version (not user adjustable)

setting.name: next_cron
setting.description: The time that a cron script next needs running

setting.name: cron_active
setting.description: The time the cron job was started, or 0 if it has finished.

setting.name: graph_count
setting.description: Count we are up to for generated graphs

setting.name: ticket_temp_reminder1
setting.description: How many hours after the user has submitted an incomplete ticket should the first reminder email be sent

setting.name: ticket_temp_reminder2
setting.description: How many hours after the first reminder should the second and final reminder be sent

setting.name: ticket_temp_clean
setting.description: How many hours after the reminders were sent to finally clean up and remove incomplete tickets from the system.

setting.name: license
setting.description: The license key required for {$DP_NAME} to function

setting.name: gzip_level
setting.description: Set the GZIP level to encode pages.

setting.name: serialize_secure_string
setting.description: A random string used to generate a secure MD5 checksum of serialized content to catch data tampering and to prevent exploitation.

setting.name: register_url
setting.description: An alternate script to redirect the user to when they go the the reigster page

setting.name: allow_registration
setting.description: You can disable new user registrations if you want to temporarily prevent new users being created or if you only want to create users manually through the technician interface. Enabling this will also prevent users from being created by the email gateway independent of any email gateway registration options chosen.

setting.name: gateway_guest_deny
setting.display_name: Deny guest messages sent to gateway?
setting.description: This lets you simply sent a rejection note to the user with a link to register isntead of using the new tempticket system to let them register later.

setting.name: register_validate_user
setting.description: Enabling this will require a user to validate their email address upon registering. Only applies to the web interface.

setting.name: register_validate_tech
setting.description: Enabling this will require technicians to validate each user that registers, this includes any user created by sending an email through the gateway interface.

setting.name: register_newticket_auto
setting.display_name: Register Users Automatically After New Ticket
setting.description: Instead of redirecting users to a registration form after submitting a ticket, the user is registered automatically.

setting.name: default_category_id
setting.description: The default category ID (instead of None) used when users are creating tickets

setting.name: default_priority_id
setting.description: The default priority ID (instead of None) used when users are creating tickets

setting.name: spam_filter
setting.display_name: Type of spam filter to use (only 'deskpro' supported right now)

setting.name: dp_spam_threshold
setting.display_name: Threshold for marking messages as spam

setting.name: dp_spam_threshold_del
setting.display_name: Threshold for deleting spam messages outright

setting.name: plugin_manual_seo_url
setting.display_name: Enable SEO'ed URLs in the manual?
setting.description: Enable SEO URLs

setting.name: plugin_manual_comment_captcha
setting.description: Captcha for manual comments

setting.name: plugin_manual_print_page
setting.description: Enable printable manual pages

setting.name: plugin_manual_single_page
setting.description: Enable single page manual download

setting.name: plugin_manual_zip
setting.description: Enable ZIP manual download

setting.name: plugin_chat_autoassign
setting.description: Method of auto-assigning new chats.

setting.name: plugin_chat_autoassign_techdep
setting.description: Use techs selected for departments for auto-assignments

setting.name: plugin_chat_autoassign_always
setting.description: Always auto-assign. Use all online techs if department techs are not available.

setting.name: plugin_chat_autocreate_user
setting.description: Automatically create a new user if they enter an email address and the email is not associated with an account

setting.name: plugin_chat_user_wait_time
setting.description: How many minutes of no tech should pass before showing the "try submitting a ticket" message

setting.name: plugin_chat_proactive_to_chat
setting.display_name: Go straight to chat after accepting proactive chat
setting.description: When a user accepts a proactive chat, take them directly to the chat window instead of the intermediate window asking about the department etc

setting.name: plugin_chat_proactive_auto_time
setting.description: How long until an auto-chat init is sent to a user

setting.name: plugin_chat_proactive_auto_pages
setting.description: How many page views until an auto-chat init is sent to a user

setting.name: plugin_chat_proactive_auto_delay
setting.description: How long after a page load until an auto-chat invitiation is displayed (seconds, 0 to disable)

setting.name: billing_credits_word_noun
setting.display_name: Word used when describing the credits currency

setting.name: billing_credits_word_html
setting.display_name: Phrase used when displaying credit values (HTML)

setting.name: billing_credits_word_text
setting.display_name: Phrase used when displaying credit values (Text)

setting.name: billing_currency_word_noun
setting.display_name: Word used when describing the real-money currency

setting.name: billing_currency_word_html
setting.display_name: Phrase used when displaying real money values (HTML)

setting.name: billing_currency_word_text
setting.display_name: Phrase used when displaying real money values (Text)

setting.name: billing_time_interval
setting.display_name: How the time fees are applied. Example: every half hour, hourly, daily.

setting.name: billing_time_round
setting.display_name: Always round up/down to this fraction of time.
setting.description: For example, if charged hourly and you worked 1:55 hours, a value of 1/4 would round this up to 2 hours.

setting.name: billing_time_min
setting.description: If rounding made the value 0, the user will be charged for this minimum time.

setting.name: billing_add_funds_min_credits
setting.description: The minimum amount a user is allowed to add when adding funds to their account balance.

setting.name: billing_contact_email
setting.description: An email address that people can use when they need to ask about billing. If this email address is monitored by DeskPRO, you should ensure (via billing rules) that the cost for a ticket is nothing.

setting.name: attachment_filesystem_enable
setting.description: When enabled, attachments will be stored in the filesystem instead of the database.

setting.name: attachment_filesystem_basepath
setting.display_name: Base path to store files in the filesystem
setting.description: The base path in the filesystem to store files.

setting.name: tech_newticket_sendtoself
setting.display_name: Send new ticket notifications to tech ticket starter
setting.description: When enabled, a tech-created ticket generates a notifications for the tech starter. (Usually the tech starter is excluded, since it's assumed they don't need a notification).

setting.name: ideas_enable
setting.description: This is a global on/off switch for the Ideas features.

setting.name: ideas_enable_comments
setting.description: Enable or disable comments globally. If you turn this off, existing comments will remain in the database but they won't be displayed.

setting.name: ideas_num_votes_per_user
setting.description: The number of votes each user gets. Votes are returned to users when ideas are accepted or declined.

setting.name: ideas_num_votes_per_idea
setting.display_name: Maximum number of votes per idea
setting.description: The maximum number of votes a user can allocate to a single idea.

setting.name: ideas_enable_ajaxsubmit
setting.description: When enabled, new ideas can be submitted via AJAX. Users don't need to be logged in (even if Guest perms disable new ideas).
